title: How to watch Manchester City vs . Real Madrid - UEFA Champions League : Knockout play - offs | Channel , stream , preview
body_text:
Two of the greatest clubs in the history of football meet up in a heavyweight match in the opening round of the knockout stage of the 2024-25 UEFA Champions League season, as Manchester City plays host to Real Madrid on Tuesday.
- Watch the UEFA Champions League on FuboTV (7-day free trial) and Paramount+
The fact that two clubs of this stature are already facing off this early in the tournament is surprising. Unlike years past when the teams were split up into separate groups, the new format saw clubs face eight different teams, providing a different outlook on the season.
For Manchester City, they didn’t quite have the best opening round. The three-time defending English Premier League champions went a measly 3-2-3, finishing 22nd in the 36-team pool, escaping elimination thanks to goal differential.
Real Madrid, the defending UCL champions, also struggled for stretches of the early part of the season. The powerhouse La Liga club also lost three times, but their five wins put them in the seeded portion of the rankings, finishing 11th, just four points ahead of Manchester City, but one back of getting a bye into the Round of 16.
Real Madrid was able to end Manchester City’s hopes of a repeat treble last year, knocking them out in the quarterfinals.
UEFA CHAMPIONS LEAGUE
Knockout Play-offs (First Leg)
Manchester City FC vs. CF Real Madrid
When: Tuesday, February 11
Time: 3 p.m. ET
Where: Etihad Stadium (Manchester, U.K.)
Channel: TUDN, UniMas
Stream: FuboTV (Free trial), Sling, DirecTV Stream, Paramount+
